title: 114_hr5139
content: The Act titled "No Defense Contracts for Terror Profiteers Act of 2016" limits the Department of Defense's use of funds in fiscal year 2017 to procure goods or services from persons providing material support to certain Iranian individuals. The Act prohibits the Department of Defense from using funds in fiscal year 2017 to procure goods or services from individuals supporting covered Iranian persons. The Federal Acquisition Regulation will require contractors to certify they do not engage in such conduct for contracts above a certain threshold. The Secretary of Defense can waive this requirement. The Secretary of Defense, with input from the Secretary of State and the Secretary of the Treasury, can waive the limitation on procuring goods or services from individuals supporting covered Iranian persons if it is deemed important to national security. The waiver must be justified and notified to Congress at least 30 days prior to taking effect. The term "appropriate committees of Congress" refers to the Senate's Committee on Armed Services and Committee on Foreign Relations. The term "covered Iranian person" refers to an Iranian individual blocked by the Office of Foreign Assets Control for acting on behalf of the Government of Iran. The text chunk discusses individuals who are blocked under Executive Order 13599 or are owned by Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps or other Iranian entities on the list of specially designated nationals. The text chunk defines an "Iranian person" as an individual who is a national of Iran or an entity organized under Iranian laws. It also explains that a "person" refers to the definition in section 560.305 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. The term "significant transaction or transactions" is defined in accordance with section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations, effective on January 1, 2016.
